data.title: 8 Best Car Insurance Companies Of August 2024
data.meta_description: Nationwide, Erie, Travelers and USAA are the best car insurance companies for 2024, according to Forbes Advisor’s analysis. See our other top picks.
data.text:
The Best Car Insurance Companies of August 2024

How We Chose the Best Car Insurance Companies

We analyzed car insurance costs, coverage options, complaint data and collision repair claims service. Our editorial content is not influenced by advertisers. We use data-driven methodologies to evaluate insurance companies so all companies are measured equally. You can read more about our editorial guidelines and the methodology for the ratings below.

We worked with a survey company to gather proprietary user comments for the products listed below.

181,925 car insurance rates analyzed

130 coverage details evaluated

102 years of insurance experience on the editorial team

The Best Car Insurance Companies in More Detail

Best Overall

Nationwide

5.0

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Average annual cost for good drivers

$1,436

Collision repair grade

C

Digital experience

Average

Get Quotes

Compare rates via EverQuote’s website

$1,436

C

Average

Editors' Take

Nationwide impressed us with its combination of excellent rates and many helpful add-on coverage offerings. Its car insurance rates are competitive across the board for various driving records and ages. We also like that it has low complaints about its auto insurance.

Some of the cheapest rates for teens and seniors among the insurers we evaluated.

Has a pay-per-mile insurance program (SmartMiles) for low-mileage drivers.

Offers accident forgiveness, gap insurance, new car replacement and vanishing deductible options.

More: Nationwide Car Insurance Review

Expert’s Take

Nationwide has solid products that are full-featured and competitively priced. Their efforts and investments to improve customer experience across the board are also showing positive reception by consumers.

– Marty Ellingsworth, advisory board member

Drawbacks

Costs for drivers with a DUI are higher than some top competitors.

Doesn’t offer rideshare insurance.

Trends in Complaints and Collision Repair Quality

Complaints

Nationwide’s complaint levels have fallen in the last couple of years and have been below the industry average.

Collision Repair Quality

Nationwide has consistently received a C from repair specialists for its collision claim processes, indicating its claims handling is only average.

Year Nationwide’s Collision Repair Grade 2021

C

2022

C

2023

C

2024

C

States Available In

Nationwide car insurance is available in 46 states and Washington, D.C. It is not available in Alaska, Hawaii, Louisiana or Massachusetts.

Best for Military Members & Veterans

USAA

4.8

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Average annual cost for good drivers

$1,364

Collision repair grade

D+

Digital experience

Average

Get Quotes

Compare rates via EverQuote’s website

$1,364

D+

Average

Editors' Take

We like USAA for those in the military community because of its low-cost car insurance for motorists with all types of driving records and varying ages. You must be a military member, veteran, or military family member to be eligible for USAA auto insurance, and the company understands this community’s needs.

Lowest average rate for good drivers among the top-rated companies in our analysis

Offers accident forgiveness and new car replacement.

Has rideshare insurance.

Has a low level of complaints.

More: USAA Car Insurance Review

Expert’s Take

No one is more member-mission-focused on active duty military car owners than USAA. There are whispers of eligibility expansion that would be terrifically received by every military family member who was not able to have a USAA number directly passed down.

– Marty Ellingsworth, advisory board member

Drawbacks

Eligibility limited to veterans, active members of the military and their immediate families.

Does not offer gap insurance.

Has a low grade (D+) from repair professionals for its collision repair claims processes.

Trends in Complaints and Collision Repair Quality

Complaints

USAA’s auto insurance complaint level has improved slightly over the last three years. It has gone from somewhat above the industry average to right below it.

Collision Repair Quality

USAA’s grade from repair professionals for its claim handling processes has steadily declined over the last four years, resulting in a poor grade of a D+ in 2024.

Year USAA's Collision Repair Grade 2021

C+

2022

C

2023

C-

2024

D+

States Available In

USAA is available in all 50 states and Washington, D.C.

Great for Drivers with a Speeding Ticket

Travelers

4.7

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Average annual cost for good drivers

$1,521

Collision repair grade

C

Digital experience

Average

Get Quotes

Compare rates via EverQuote’s website

$1,521

C

Average

Editors' Take

We picked Travelers because it has decent rates overall for a variety of drivers, including those with speeding tickets or who have caused an accident. It also has many options for additional coverage, making it a good choice to consider when comparison shopping.

Its optional Responsible Driver Plan includes accident forgiveness and minor violation forgiveness. If you upgrade to a Premier policy, you also get a decreasing deductible and a deductible waiver if your car is totaled.

Offers new car replacement coverage.

Has a very low level of complaints made about it to state insurance departments.

More: Travelers Car Insurance Review

Expert’s Take

Everyone feels safer under the red umbrella. It’s not just a logo; it is a promise maintained with independent agents and more direct contact with car owners.

– Marty Ellingsworth, advisory board member

Drawbacks

Offers rideshare insurance but only in a couple of states.

Doesn’t offer SR-22s.

Trends in Complaints and Collision Repair Quality

Complaints

Travelers has consistently had very low levels of complaints about its auto insurance.

Collision Repair Quality

Travelers’ collision repair grade has dropped from a C+ to a C in the last couple of years. This grade indicates that Travelers has only a mediocre claims process in place.

Year Travelers' Collision Repair Grade 2021

C+

2022

C+

2023

C

2024

C

States Available In

Travelers auto insurance is available in 42 states and Washington, D.C. It is not available in:

Alaska

Hawaii

Louisiana

Michigan

North Dakota

South Dakota

West Virginia

Best for drivers who caused an accident

Erie

4.6

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Average annual cost for good drivers

$1,642

Collision repair grade

A-

Digital experience

Poor

Get Quotes

Compare rates via EverQuote’s website

$1,642

A-

Poor

Editors' Take

We like Erie for its terrific car insurance rates for drivers who have caused an accident as well as budget-friendly rates for most other driver profiles. We’re also impressed by its top score for its collision repair claims processes and its low level of complaints.

Offers gap insurance and new car replacement coverage.

Has accident forgiveness and vanishing deductibles.

It’s easy to budget costs with Erie’s Rate Lock, which keeps your price the same year after year unless you make certain changes to your policy, such as adding a car.

More: Erie Car Insurance Review

Expert’s Take

Erie is a super regional insurer and is very customer focused.

– Marty Ellingsworth, advisory board member

Drawbacks

Rates for drivers with bad credit are on the high side.

Offers a poor digital experience, primarily because of its low-rated mobile app.

Only available in 12 states.

Trends in Complaints and Collision Repair Quality

Complaints

Erie’s auto insurance complaint level has fluctuated in recent years and is currently right below the industry average.

Collision Repair Quality

Erie has gotten excellent grades from repair specialists over the past four years. That means body shops find Erie’s claims handling practices help ensure quality repairs.

Year Erie's Collision Repair Grade 2021

A-

2022

B+

2023

A-

2024

A-

States Available In

Erie is available in 12 states and Washington, D.C.:

Illinois

Indiana

Kentucky

Maryland

New York

North Carolina

Ohio

Pennsylvania

Tennessee

Virginia

West Virginia

Wisconsin

Best for Drivers With a DUI

Progressive

4.4

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Average annual cost for good drivers

$1,826

Collision repair grade

C

Digital experience

Good

Get Quotes

Compare rates via EverQuote’s website

$1,826

C

Good

Editors' Take

We like Progressive because it offers the cheapest rates for drivers with a DUI among the companies we evaluated. It also has a low level of complaints, which helps offset its only so-so rates for good drivers and those who have caused accidents.

Offers accident forgiveness, gap insurance and a vanishing deductible.

Provides nonowner car insurance and SR-22 filings.

Has a pretty good average discount for teachers (13%).

More: Progressive Insurance Review

Expert’s Take

Progressive started decades ago with a focus on drivers with problems, so it understands how to write policies for risks other insurers don’t. Its use of data from smartphone-assisted insights is some of the best in the market to give drivers feedback on their behavior behind the wheel.

– Marty Ellingsworth, advisory board member

Drawbacks

Rates are mediocre for senior drivers and those adding a teen to a policy.

Good drivers can try Progressive’s usage-based program (Snapshot) to potentially receive a decent discount. But your rates could go up if your driving score is low. Progressive says rates go up for 20% of drivers who use Snapshot.

Trends in Complaints and Collision Repair Quality

Complaints

Progressive’s auto insurance complaint levels have consistently been below the industry average and have been going down in each year of the past three years.

Collision Repair Quality

Progressive has consistently received a C for collision repair over the last four years, meaning its claims processes are just average.

Year Progressive’s Collision Repair Grade 2021

C

2022

C

2023

C

2024

C

States Available In

Progressive is available in all 50 states and Washington, D.C.

Great for Drivers With Poor Credit

Geico

4.2

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Average annual cost for good drivers

$1,597

Collision repair grade

C-

Digital experience

Very good

Get Quotes

Compare rates via EverQuote’s website

$1,597

C-

Very good

Editors' Take

We like that Geico has relatively cheap insurance for drivers with poor credit, whose rates are typically pretty high. Geico is also competitively priced for many other types of drivers and for parents adding a teen driver to policies.

Great rates for seniors, who typically can be expensive to insure.

Offers accident forgiveness, non-owner policies and SR-22 filings.

Low level of complaints about car insurance filed with state insurance departments.

Received a 5-star rating from us for its digital experience.

More: Geico Car Insurance Review

Expert’s Take

Geico’s internal comparison of the risk process gives it more latitude in pricing for drivers with credit issues than other competitors.

– Marty Ellingsworth, advisory board member

Drawbacks

Doesn’t offer gap insurance.

You’ll have to look elsewhere if you want coverage features such as new car replacement, a vanishing deductible or rideshare insurance.

Trends in Complaints and Collision Repair Quality

Complaints

Geico has remained consistent with low complaint levels over the past three years.

Collision Repair Quality

Repair professionals at body shops nationwide have consistently given Geico a C- grade. Geico could work to improve its claim repair procedures.

Year Geico's Collision Repair Grade 2021

C-

2022

2023

States Available In

Geico car insurance is available in all 50 states and Washington, D.C.

Best for Family Discounts

Westfield

4.2

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Average annual cost for good drivers

$1,984

Editors' Take

We’re impressed with Westfield’s various family discounts, including a discount for teen drivers and adult children obtaining their own Westfield car insurance policies. It also has a very low level of complaints.

Competitive car insurance rates for many driver profiles.

Offers gap insurance, new car replacement and accident forgiveness.

Received a high grade (B) for its collision claims process.

More: Westfield Car Insurance Review

Expert’s Take

Westfied’s family discounts show that it’s a customer-focused company. It’s also a win for Westfield to improve the retention of its customers by rewarding households in this manner.

– Marty Ellingsworth, advisory board member

Drawbacks

Highest average auto insurance cost for drivers with a DUI among the companies we analyzed.

Very poor digital experience, primarily due to its lack of a mobile app and online quotes.

Only available in 10 states.

Trends in Complaints and Collision Repair Quality

Complaints

Westfield auto insurance has consistently had a low level of complaints about its auto insurance, but complaint data is not available for the most recent year.

Collision Repair Quality

Westfield has received a respectable B grade from collision repair specialists for the last four years, which is a good indicator that it has decent repair processes and policies.

Year Westfield’s Collision Repair Grade 2021

Best for New Cars

Auto-Owners

4.0

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Average annual cost for good drivers

$1,855

Collision repair grade

B

Digital experience

Very poor

Get Quotes

Compare rates via EverQuote’s website

$1,855

B

Very poor

Editors' Take

We like Auto-Owners for its plentiful options for new car owners. One is its “purchase price guarantee,” which pays you the original purchase price if your car is totaled within the first two years. Another is “total loss to a new automobile” coverage, which replaces a totaled vehicle with a new one if the loss occurs within 90 days of your vehicle purchase.

Offers gap insurance, accident forgiveness and a diminishing deductible.

Low level of complaints against it for auto insurance.

Received a high grade (B) from collision experts on its claim processes.

More: Auto-Owners Car Insurance Review

Expert’s Take

The best drivers with the newest technology can find a good deal with Auto-Owners. They don’t sell auto insurance in every state, but get a quote for your new car if you can.

– Marty Ellingsworth, advisory board member

Drawbacks

High rates for drivers with poor credit and for parents adding a teen to their policies.

No SR-22 filings.

Very poor digital experience due to its lack of online quotes and live chat options.

Trends in Complaints and Collision Repair Quality

Complaints

Auto-Owners has consistently had lower complaints than the industry average over the past three years.

Collision Repair Quality

Auto-Owners’ collision repair grade has fallen slightly in the last couple of years—going from a B+ to a B—but that’s still a great grade and points to it having good repair practices in place.

What Is the Best Car Insurance Company?

Our analysis finds that Nationwide, USAA, Traveler and Erie are the best car companies, all receiving over 4.5 stars (out of 5) in our ratings.

The best car insurance companies for you will depend on your driving record, state and other individual factors. We recommend shopping around to compare car insurance quotes, as the company with the lowest rates will depend on your specific profile.

Best Overall: Nationwide

Nationwide is the best overall car insurance company thanks to its great rates for a variety of driving records and driver ages, its wide range of coverage options and its low level of complaints.

Nationwide’s average rate for good drivers is 29% lower than the national average. It has the cheapest rates for drivers with poor credit, parents adding a teen driver and drivers age 65 to 80, among companies we evaluated.

Company Average cost per year for good drivers

$1,364

$1,436

$1,984

National average

$2,026

Best for Military Members: USAA

USAA is the best car insurance option for military members year after year with its consistently cheap rates and variety of coverage options. USAA sells exclusively to military members, veterans and their family members. It offers a discount of up to 60% if you store your car while you’re deployed and up to 15% for drivers who garage their cars on a base.

USAA’s average rate for good drivers is 33% below the national average. Costs for those with a speeding ticket are 34% lower and 35% lower for drivers who caused an accident with injuries.

Great for Drivers With a Speeding Ticket: Travelers

Travelers offers low-cost insurance for drivers with a speeding ticket. While its rates aren’t the cheapest, they are 19% lower than the national average for drivers with a speeding violation. We found that Travelers’ average cost for insurance after a speeding ticket is lower than many of its competitors.

Best for Drivers Who Caused an Accident: Erie

Erie has the best rates for drivers who caused an accident with injuries or property damage. USAA is a bit cheaper for both but its policies are only available to military members, veterans and their families.

Causing an accident leads to an average of 49% increase if there are injuries and 48% increase if there is property damage. Erie’s costs only go up 35% if you cause an accident with injuries and just 29% if you cause property damage.

Best for Drivers With a DUI: Progressive

Progressive offers the cheapest rates for drivers with a DUI among the companies we analyzed. A DUI is considered a major offense so it can really hike up your insurance. Our analysis found rates go up by 71% on average for drivers with a DUI, but Progressive’s rates only increase 26%.

Company Average cost per year for a driver with one DUI

Great for Drivers With Poor Credit: Geico

Geico offers lower rates to drivers with poor credit compared to other top insurers. Its rates are also 36% cheaper than the national average.

Company Average cost per year for drivers with poor credit

National average

$3,847

Best for Family Discounts: Westfield

Compared to other top-rated companies, Westfield has an excellent variety of discounts so family members can save on car insurance. It offers a family discount, next generation discount and companion car insurance discount.

Best for New Cars: Auto-Owners

Auto-Owners offers new-vehicle owners exceptional coverage options. It has two types of new car replacement coverage and gap insurance. If your new car is totaled or stolen, gap insurance pays the difference between your insurance payout and the amount still owed on a lease or loan. Also:

Auto-Owners’ “purchase price guarantee” pays you the original purchase price if your car is totaled within the first two years and you’re the original car owner.

“Total loss to a new automobile” coverage pays to replace your car with a new one of equal value or pays out your original purchase price if your car is totaled within 90 days of purchase.

Not all top-rated companies offer new car replacement coverage and the ones that do usually offer just one type.

Company Offers gap insurance Offers new car replacement

Best Digital Experience: Geico

Are car insurance companies keeping up with increasing consumer demands for a delightful digital experience? We found out by analyzing mobile app ratings and website functionality. We discovered that Geico currently has the overall best digital experience among the companies that otherwise scored well in our analysis of the best auto insurers.

Company Forbes Advisor rating for digital experience Our expert take

Geico

5.0 stars

Geico leaves its competitors in the dust thanks to the live chat on its website, high user ratings for its mobile apps (4.7 out of 5) and online quotes. It also has a Spanish website version.

Progressive

4.0 stars

Progressive scored well for its mobile app ratings (4.7 out of 5), helpful site search and online quotes. But there’s no Spanish version of its site or live chat.

Nationwide

3.9 stars

Nationwide’s app has a good user rating (4.6 out of 5), a helpful site search and online quotes. It lacks a live chat and Spanish version.

USAA

3.7 stars

USAA’s mobile app has decent user ratings (4.4 out of 5), online quotes and a good site search. But it comes up with no Spanish version and its live chat leaves a lot to be desired: There are only five pre-set questions, none of which could answer our test question about how to get policy documents.

Travelers

3.4 stars

Travelers’ average mobile app rating (4.1 out of 5) is OK, and it has online quotes and a good site search. But like many others in our analysis, it lacks a Spanish version and online chat.

Erie

2.2 stars

Erie’s mobile app fails to impress, with a low user rating (2.9 out of 5). It does have online quotes and a good site search, but it lacks online chat and a Spanish version.

Auto-Owners

No stars

Auto-Owners failed to earn any stars in our analysis mainly due to its lack of online quotes, a site search that is not helpful and no online chat.

Westfield

No stars

Westfield lacks basic digital features: No mobile app, no online quotes, no online chat and a site search that delivers poor results.

Expert Tips

Tips for Finding the Best Car Insurance

Marty Ellingsworth

Advisory Board Member

Penny Gusner

Insurance Senior Writer

Amy Danise

Insurance Managing Editor

Michelle Megna

Insurance Lead Editor

Les Masterson

Insurance Editor

Jason Metz

Insurance Lead Editor

Shop Around Frequently

When it comes to auto insurance shopping advice, early, often and regularly are the three watchwords to remember. I recommend making insurance shopping a regular exercise and not once a decade, when you trade in a vehicle or only when rates go up. Take advantage of all your resources—call your company to ask for discounts, use the internet to get multiple quotes, ask a local agent to describe options, and don’t forget to ask your family and neighbors.

Marty Ellingsworth

Advisory Board Member

Don’t Overlook Small Insurers

I recommend looking at companies of all sizes when searching for the best insurance company. If you count out small insurers, you may miss out on a company that offers good coverage perks and superb rates.

Penny Gusner

Insurance Senior Writer

Be Cautious About Usage-Based Insurance

Your car insurance company might suggest you become part of a telematics program, aka usage-based auto insurance. If you like your privacy, I’d say this isn’t a good option for you. Your data could be shared with other insurers and even affect future car insurance quotes from other companies. Also, most people in usage-based programs do not drive well enough to get a discount.

Amy Danise

Insurance Managing Editor

Confirm There’s a Mobile App

If digital experience is important to you, make sure the insurer you’re considering has a mobile app. Believe it or not, not all insurers do! I like to have the ability to show my insurance ID card from my phone, for example.

Michelle Megna

Insurance Lead Editor

Don’t Skimp on Liability Insurance

With an increasingly litigious society, I think it’s very important to make sure you have generous liability insurance. If you haven’t paid much attention to this line item on your declarations page, I recommend taking a look. You want enough liability insurance to equal your net worth, which is essentially what you can be sued for. Buy umbrella insurance for extra liability insurance at a good price.

Les Masterson

Insurance Editor

Consider Rental Reimbursement Insurance

I think rental reimbursement insurance is an underappreciated coverage. Car repair times have been going up. Your vehicle could easily be in the shop for a collision repair for three weeks or more, waiting to get worked on and waiting for parts. This coverage can help pay for a rental, so you’re not footing the whole bill yourself.

Jason Metz

Insurance Lead Editor

How Much Does Car Insurance Cost?

Car insurance costs an average of $2,026 a year, based on our analysis of rates from large car insurance companies. That’s an average of $169 per month.

Types of Car Insurance

Knowing the types of car insurance coverage available is important to building the best policy for your specific situation. Liability is the foundation for all auto insurance policies. From there, states vary on what is required, and there is optional coverage you may want for broader coverage.

ASK AN EXPERT

Ask an expert

We Answer Your Questions

Amy Danise

Insurance Managing Editor

Penny Gusner

Insurance Senior Writer

Michelle Megna

Insurance Lead Editor

Is collision coverage part of a full coverage policy?

– Chis Z., Scottsdale, Arizona

Yes, collision is part of a full coverage policy. A full coverage policy typically includes state-required coverage like liability insurance, plus collision and comprehensive coverage. Collision insurance pays to repair your car if it’s damaged in an accident or pays its value if your car is beyond repair.

Amy Danise

Insurance Managing Editor

Will my car insurance cover my out-of-state road trip?

– Jessie D., Ocala, Florida

Yes, car insurance policies generally extend your coverage when you drive out of state. A “broadening clause” activates when you drive out of state, adjusting your policy limits to comply with the auto insurance laws of the state you’re visiting. Your policy likely also extends coverage for driving in Canada, but car insurance coverage for Mexico is typically limited, if extended at all.

Penny Gusner

Insurance Senior Writer

Does car insurance cover the theft of my car?

– John S., Oakland, California

Yes, if you have comprehensive coverage as part of your policy. Comprehensive coverage pays the value of your vehicle if it’s stolen and not recovered. It also pays for repairs to your vehicle if it’s damaged due to vandalism, fire, severe weather like hail or floodwaters, striking an animal or falling objects.

Michelle Megna

Insurance Lead Editor

Methodology

To identify the best car insurance companies we evaluated each company based on its average rates for a variety of drivers, the coverage options offered, complaints against the company and collision repair grades from auto body professionals.

Auto insurance rates (50% of score): We used data from Quadrant Information Services to find average rates from each company for good drivers, drivers who have caused an accident, drivers with a speeding ticket, drivers with a DUI, drivers with poor credit, drivers caught without insurance, adding a teen driver, senior drivers and young drivers.

Unless otherwise noted, rates are based on a 40-year-old female driver with a Toyota RAV4 and coverage of:

$100,000 for injuries to one person, $300,000 for injuries per accident and $100,000 of property damage (known as 100/300/100).

Uninsured motorist coverage of 100/300.

Collision and comprehensive insurance with a $500 deductible.

Car insurance coverage options (25% of score): Any auto insurance company can provide the basics of liability insurance, collision and comprehensive coverage and other standard offerings. But it’s also important to have access to additional coverage types that can provide greater protection or cost savings. In this category, we gave points to companies that offer accident forgiveness, new car replacement, vanishing deductibles, usage-based or pay-per-mile insurance and SR-22s.

Complaints (20% of score): We used complaint data from the National Association of Insurance Commissioners. Each state’s department of insurance is in charge of logging and monitoring complaints against companies operating in their states. Most auto insurance complaints center on claims, including unsatisfactory settlements, delays, and denials.

The industry complaint average is 1.00, so companies with a ratio below 1.00 have lower levels of complaints.

Collision repair (5% of score): We incorporated insurance company grades from collision repair professionals. We used data provided by CRASH Network, a weekly newsletter covering the collision repair and auto insurance market segments. CRASH Network’s Insurer Report Card used grades from more than 1,100 collision repair professionals to gauge auto insurers on the quality of their collision claims service.

Auto Insurance Collision Repair Grades

Read more: How Forbes Advisor rates car insurance companies

Methodology for Our Digital Experience Ratings

Our Digital Experience ratings reflect the quality of a company’s mobile app and website. Ratings are based on:

Car insurance quotes online (40% of score): Companies with car insurance quotes available on their websites earned points.

Website has live helpful chat (20% of score): We gave points to companies that have live chat (whether from a person or a chatbot) that is helpful. To measure helpfulness, we asked, “How do I get a copy of my car insurance policy?” and gave points for a direct and helpful answer.

Average mobile app rating (20% of score): We averaged mobile app ratings from Android and iOS users when there were 200 or more reviews.

Website has helpful search function (15% of score): Companies earned points for having a site search and for showing a helpful page within the first two results for a search for “comprehensive insurance.”

Website Spanish version (5% of score): Companies earned points for having a link to a Spanish version on their home pages.
